author: Daniel
title: Fifa ordenÃ³ a la FVF pagarle a Pekerman todo lo que le debÃ­aâ€¦ con intereses
text:
La FIFA ordenÃ³ a Venezuela pagarle casi 3 millones de dÃ³lares a JosÃ© Pekerman tras una demanda del entrenador argentino por â€œincumplimientoâ€ del acuerdo para rescindir su contrato como seleccionador de la Vinotinto, segÃºn un documento conocido este jueves por la AFP.
La FederaciÃ³n Venezolana de FÃºtbol (FVF) â€œtiene que pagarâ€ a Pekerman 1,71 millones de dÃ³lares por â€œremuneraciÃ³n adeudadaâ€, mÃ¡s 5% de interÃ©s anual desde el 23 de agosto de 2023 hasta el momento en que se salde la deuda, y 1,14 millones de dÃ³lares por â€œpenalidadâ€, segÃºn la decisiÃ³n del Tribunal de FÃºtbol de la FIFA, fechada el pasado 6 de noviembre.
â€œCualquier otra demanda del demandante queda rechazadaâ€, agrega el documento.
Pekerman, de 74 aÃ±os, dejÃ³ de ser entrenador de la selecciÃ³n de Venezuela en marzo de 2023, a las puertas del inicio de la clasificatoria para el Mundial 2026, tras un ciclo que apenas durÃ³ 15 meses.
Fernando â€˜Bochaâ€™ Batista, quien era su ayudante de campo en la selecciÃ³n venezolana, tomÃ³ su lugar.
La AFP intentÃ³ comunicarse, sin Ã©xito, con voceros de la FVF.
Pekerman habÃ­a asumido el cargo en noviembre de 2021 con la promesa de liderar una reestructuraciÃ³n del fÃºtbol en el Ãºnico paÃ­s de SudamÃ©rica que jamÃ¡s ha clasificado a la Copa del Mundo.
Su antecesor, el portuguÃ©s Jose Peseiro, renunciÃ³ a la Vinotinto denunciando una deuda salarial de 14 meses que luego fue saldada. El local Leo GonzÃ¡lez fue interino despuÃ©s de la salida del europeo.
Reportes de prensa en Venezuela indicaron que el rompimiento de la FVF y Pekerman habÃ­a llegado tras â€œirregularidadesâ€ en la gestiÃ³n de Pascual Lezcano, mano derecha del tÃ©nico, que habrÃ­an sido detectadas en una auditorÃ­a.
La FVF nunca confirmÃ³, pÃºblicamente, esas versiones.
Pekerman dirigiÃ³ a su natal Argentina en el Mundial de Alemania-2006 y a Colombia en Brasil-2014 y Rusia-2018 y previamente habÃ­a sido tricampeÃ³n mundial Sub-20 al frente de la selecciÃ³n albiceleste en 1995, 1997 y 2001.
AFP

title: Apostle Supper Club across from the Xcel Energy Center to close | Flipboard
text:

author: Roberto Pico
title: Mientras se debate la Ley Bases, Caputo define la baja del impuesto Pais
text: El ministro de EconomÃ­a Luis Caputo se enfrenta a su promesa de rebajar el impuesto Pais [mientras se debate la sanciÃ³n definitiva de la Ley de Bases y el paquete fiscal](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/politica/ley-bases-es-la-reforma-mas-importante-de-la-historia-dijo-martin-menem/), y el mercado aguarda el anuncio para calibrar el impacto sobre el equilibrio fiscal que pretende el Gobierno. En medio de las negociaciones para que las leyes sean aprobadas, [Caputo](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/politica/caputo-no-vi-a-periodistas-llorando-durante-los-ultimos-cuatro-anos/) presionÃ³ con el anuncio de que reducirÃ­a la alÃ­cuota de este impuesto del 17,5 al 7,5% cuando ambas normas quedaran firmes. Con el Ãºltimo trÃ¡mite en la CÃ¡mara de Diputados sÃ³lo queda la promulgaciÃ³n por parte del Poder Ejecutivo y dado que todo se precipitÃ³ sobre fin de junio, aparecen las especulaciones acerca de que Caputo finalmente cumpla con su palabra y la reducciÃ³n del impuesto Pais rija desde el lunes 1Â° de julio. Al formular su promesa, Caputo estuvo hÃ¡bil en no dar demasiados detalles y eso abre diferentes escenarios acerca de cÃ³mo se implementarÃ­a la medida. El abanico de opciones en los que aplica el impuesto Pais es muy amplio: compra de moneda extranjera para ahorro, para el pago de servicios turÃ­sticos, suscripciÃ³n de bonos o tÃ­tulos emitidos por el BCRA, y para el giro de dividendos, entre otros. De allÃ­ que resulta determinante a quÃ© operaciones se le reducirÃ¡ la alÃ­cuota del impuesto. Cabe recordar que fue el propio Caputo el que decidiÃ³ el aumento de 7,5% a 17.5% de este tributo cuando lanzÃ³ sus primeras medidas econÃ³micas en diciembre, con lo cual ahora sÃ³lo se retornarÃ­a al escenario que regÃ­a seis meses atrÃ¡s. Las dudas de los analistas pasan por el impacto en la recaudaciÃ³n ya que el gravamen se convirtiÃ³ en uno de los pilares de los ingresos fiscales. Una de los efectos directos serÃ­a la caÃ­da del costo de los insumos importados que genera dos efectos: beneficios para algunas empresas porque abaratan costos de producciÃ³n y perjuicio para aquellas que deberÃ¡n competir contra el ingreso de mercaderÃ­a del exterior a menor precio. Pero lo que esperan saber los analistas es cÃ³mo quedarÃ¡ la grilla de impuestos y establecer cÃ³mo [Caputo ](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/negocios/que-esperan-los-mercados-de-javier-milei-segun-santiago-bulat/)conseguirÃ¡ los fondos para compensar la reducciÃ³n prometida. En los primeros cinco meses del aÃ±o, este gravamen la aportÃ³ al fisco $ 2,8 billones, sobre un total de $ 44,7 billones, lo que equivale a un 6%, un volumen que dada la situaciÃ³n general y la demora en la reactivaciÃ³n no parece sencillo de nivelar. Ganancias La inminente aprobaciÃ³n en [Diputados ](https://www.lavoz.com.ar/politica/diputados-la-pelea-por-ganancias-y-un-articulo-para-recortar-beneficios-impositivos-del-estado/)establece que el mÃ­nimo no imponible para el impuesto a las Ganancias quedarÃ¡ en $ 1.800.000 para solteros y $ 2.200.000 para casados con hijos. Se estima que 1 millÃ³n de trabajadores volverÃ¡n a pagar el impuesto con alÃ­cuotas que van del 5 al 35%. HabrÃ¡ actualizaciones semestrales por el Ãndice de Precios al Consumidor (IPC) desde 2025 y este aÃ±o habrÃ¡ una adicional en septiembre. La OPC estimÃ³ que la restituciÃ³n de este impuesto sumarÃ¡ 0,43 puntos del PBI de recaudaciÃ³n, lo que serÃ­a equivalente a unos U$S 2.530 millones. Este es el punto que mÃ¡s les interesa a las provincias porque se coparticipa un 42% para NaciÃ³n y un 56% para las provincias, aproximadamente. Aunque resta definir la reglamentaciÃ³n de la norma se estima que podrÃ­a comenzar a regir desde el lunes 1Â° de julio. En el Senado no prosperÃ³ el aumento del mÃ­nimo no imponible que pretendÃ­an los legisladores patagÃ³nicos en defensa de los trabajadores del sector petrolero. Bienes Personales La norma tambiÃ©n establece una actualizaciÃ³n del impuesto a los Bienes Personales y el nuevo piso del tributo pasarÃ¡ de $ 27 millones a $ 100 millones, mientras que la deducciÃ³n por la vivienda familiar pasarÃ¡ a $ 350 millones. A su vez, los patrimonios hasta fin de 2023 serÃ¡n gravados con tasas de entre 0,5% y 1,5%. Luego entre 2024 y 2026 sÃ³lo quedarÃ¡n vigentes alÃ­cuotas de 1,25% y 1,5%, para desde 2027 unificarse en una Ãºnica tasa de 0,25%. El Gobierno tambiÃ©n impulso un esquema de pago anticipado para los perÃ­odos 2023 a 2027, con una tasa unificada de 0,45%, que se eleva a 0,5% para los bienes que ingresen al blanqueo. Este es el incentivo que el Gobierno quiso conservar porque apuesta a que la â€œexteriorizaciÃ³n de capitalesâ€ le aporte puntos extras de recaudaciÃ³n. Blanqueo Cuando promulgada la ley sea promulgada habilita al Ejecutivo a realizar un â€œblanqueo de capitales y aquellas personas que sinceren hasta U$S 100.000 no pagarÃ¡n ningÃºn impuesto ni tampoco ninguna penalidad. HabrÃ¡ tres etapas para adherirse. Los que exterioricen mÃ¡s de U$S 100.000 hasta el 30 de septiembre pagarÃ¡n una alÃ­cuota del 5% sobre el excedente declarado. En la segunda etapa hasta diciembre, la alÃ­cuota serÃ¡ del 10%, y en un tercer tramo durante el primer trimestre de 2025, serÃ¡ del 15%.

author: Tamara Hardingham-Gill, CNN
title: Larger cruise ships pose environmental concerns
text:
Cruise ships have doubled in size over the past two decades, a precedent that could lead to even bigger vessels plying our oceans in the future, bringing potential problems, a newly released report has warned.
The largest passenger vessels today are twice as large as they were in 2000, says a study conducted by European clean energy lobby group Transport and Environment (T&E) which warns of the environmental impact of the â€œrapidlyâ€ growing global cruise industry.
The report suggests that the biggest cruise ships setting sail in 2050 could be nearly eight times larger than the infamous Titanic, the largest passenger ship in service when it set sail in 1912 (measuring 269 meters or about 883 feet), if the growth rate continues as it is.
Disney's Wonder cruise ship and Carnival's Fantasy taking to the waters in 2004.
Bruce Weaver/AFP/Getty Images via CNN Newsource â€œTodayâ€™s cruisezillas make the Titanic look like a small fishing boat,â€ Inesa Ulichina, sustainable shipping officer at T&E, said in a statement.

author: @wis10
title: FIRST ALERT WEATHER: Heavy rain moves in tonight
text: FIRST ALERT WEATHER: Heavy rain moves in tonight COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) â€“ We want to First Alert you to heavy rain potential this evening and tonight! First Alert Headlines Â· 1-2â€³ of rain is possible tonight bringing a First Alert Weather Day for the heavy downpours. Â· Saturday morning has a few lingering showers with a 50% chance of rain. Â· Winds are picking up tonight and temps drop into the upper 30s with wind chills near 27-32. Â· Sunday will come along with widespread sunshine and a cool breeze. First Alert Summary Tonight we have a First Alert Weather Day for heavy rain in upwards of 1-2â€³. The heaviest rain happens late tonight around Midnight. Winds will gust from time to time near 25-35mph. Watch out for ponding on roadways and flooded streams! Saturday we see a 50% chance of showers in the morning and then gusty winds and less of a chance for the afternoon. Right now we have a 50% chance of rain for the morning and then it goes down as we head into the afternoon. Sunday morning our wind chills dip down into the upper 20s to low 30s as winds are up and lows are in the upper 30s. We have high pressure building into the region and that clears us up with sunny skies. Highs reach the mid 60s for the afternoon hours. Monday morning will be chilly as well with some mid to upper 30s possible. Highs reach the upper 60s with partly cloudy skies. Tuesday is warmer with mid 40s in the morning and high temps reach the low 70s. Our next good chance of rain comes in Wednesday with a cold front nearing. Lows are in the mid 50s and highs reach the low 70s. First Alert Forecast First Alert Weather Day for Tonight: Heavy rain is possible, breaking up late overnight. 100% Chance with lows in the mid to upper 50s. Saturday: Drier conditions into the day with some isolated showers here and there. Highs in the upper mid-60s. Sunday: Sunshine takes over with a cool breeze. Highs in the mid-60s. Monday: Partly cloudy with highs in the upper mid-60s. Tuesday: More clouds on the increase with highs nearing 70 degrees. Wednesday: Cloudy with a 60% chance of showers and rain highs are in the low 70s. Feel more informed, prepared, and connected with WIS. For more free content like this, subscribe to our [email newsletter](https://www.wistv.com/newsletter/), and [download our apps](https://www.wistv.com/page/apps/). Have feedback that can help us improve? [Click here](mailto:wis-webproducers@gray.tv?subject=[please%20include%20the%20article%27s%20headline%20here]). Copyright 2024 WIS. All rights reserved.

author: Fatima Kemelova
title: Tokayev Congratulates Citizens on Fatherland Defendersâ€™ Day, Victory Day
text: ASTANA â€“ President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev, the Supreme Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, congratulated citizens on Defenders of the Fatherland Day, celebrated on May 7, and Victory Day, observed on May 9. â€œToday, the valiant Kazakh army has become a reliable shield of territorial integrity and stability in the country. Our glorious warriors vigilantly guard the preservation of peace and prosperity. They are always ready to defend their sacred Fatherland,â€ Tokayev said at the solemn ceremony at Akorda residence. The President lauded the courage of Kazakhstanâ€™s military personnel amidst the countryâ€™s most severe floods in the past 80 years, citing their dedication to duty during this challenging period. He highlighted the merits of 300 military personnel in the North Kazakhstan Region, who constructed dams night and day and participated in protecting communities from the floods. Tokayev emphasized special gratitude expressed by residents towards these servicemen, stating that â€œthis is clear evidence of the indestructible unity and cohesion of the people and the army.â€ He underscored the countryâ€™s enduring gratitude to frontline soldiers and home front workers, who brought Victory closer at the cost of incredible hardships. The President mentioned annual additional payments provided to war participants on Victory Day, noting that this yearâ€™s amount [reached](https://astanatimes.com/2024/05/kazakhstan-honors-veterans-ahead-of-may-9/) three million tenge (US$6,761.11) for each veteran. He recalled that starting this year, three degrees of the Aibyn Order were given the names of legendary compatriots Sagadat Nurmagambetov, Bauyrzhan Momyshuly, and Rakhymzhan Koshkarbayev. Tokayev emphasized the increasing significance of a robust, combat-ready army amid rising geostrategic turbulence. Kazakhstanâ€™s recent mandate from the United Nations to [conduct](https://astanatimes.com/2024/03/kazakhstans-first-independent-peacekeeping-mission-reaches-golan-heights/) an independent mission in the Golan Heights, along with a strengthened position in the ranking of military power globally, clearly demonstrates the high combat readiness and coherence of Kazakh troops. According to the President, work will continue to enhance professional training and modernize the Armed Forces. Finalized efforts include opening a new air base in Astana and providing service members with educational grants and loan repayment deferments. Recognizing the significant contribution of defenders in maintaining peace and harmony, Tokayev honored military personnel with promotions and state awards for their courage and dedication to upholding national security.

author: PA News Agency
title: Thousands of homes remain without power in wake of Storm Gerrit | The Northern Echo
text:
Thousands of homes remain without power as the post-storm cleanup begins in the wake of Storm Gerrit.
Around 1,500 homes in Scotland experienced their second night without power in Scotland while a lightning strike hit supplies in Wales on Thursday.
Power company Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks said it had restored supply to more than 46,000 properties that lost power due to the storm, with people in the north east and Shetland worst affected.
âš¡ We've now restored power to 46k customers #stormgerrit ðŸ  1.5k will be off overnight, we're giving help & advice.ðŸ‘· Teams are working tonight to clear debris hindering access to faults.â˜• Full details of vans serving hot meals from 9am tomorrow are at https://t.co/HSBcM400Fh pic.twitter.com/pnHIApyUvC
â€” Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks (@ssencommunity) December 28, 2023
They said the remaining homes should be reconnected on Friday with welfare vans serving hot food and drink to affected customers from 9am.
Operations director Andy Smith said: â€œThis has been a difficult couple of days for the communities affected and Iâ€™m grateful to them for their patience and support as our teams work extremely hard to restore power.â€
National Grid UK said 36,000 properties were without power in Ceredigion on Thursday after lightning struck.
Storm Gerrit strongest gusts. See story WEATHER Gerrit. Infographic PA Graphics. An editable version of this graphic is available if required. Please contact graphics@pamediagroup.com. Three men died after their 4Ã—4 vehicle was submerged in the River Esk, near Glaisdale, on Thursday, North Yorkshire Police said.
A supercell thunderstorm moved across the northwest of England on Thursday after a similar storm is thought to have resulted in a tornado that damaged homes in Greater Manchester on Wednesday.
Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a â€œlocalised tornadoâ€ in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook.
Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighboursâ€™ houses â€œare an absolute disasterâ€ with missing roofs and â€œsquishedâ€ cars.
Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said.
Screengrab taken from PA Video of a damaged gate in Stalybridge after the Tameside tornado (Richard McCarthy/PA) ScotRail said many lines have been reopened but urged passengers to check for the latest information before travelling, a message echoed by LNER, Avanti West Coast and London Northwestern Railway who suspensed or cancelled services due to damage or system faults.
Friday will see significant disruption for travellers wishing to travel on the London Euston and Watford Junction lines with services expected to be up and running by the end of the day.
In Wales, the aftermath of the recent severe weather will see rail services hampered until Monday.
ðŸŒ¦ï¸ Blustery showers are possible on Friday morning, with these most likely in the north and west. Many of us will also see some sunshine and some places may stay dry.
ðŸŒ¬ï¸ Still windy in northern England and later Shetland, with gales possible, but otherwise somewhat less windy. pic.twitter.com/hInP8LNF2c
â€” Met Office (@metoffice) December 28, 2023
Ferry services also experienced cancellations and delays due to storm activity with operator DFDS confirming sailings between Dover and France were delayed due to strong winds in the English Channel.
Air travel in and out of the UK saw cancellations but most services have returned to normal.
The Met Office reported the worst of Storm Gerrit had passed with the last few days of 2023 forecast to be unsettled with strong winds, rain and even snow on higher ground.
Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: â€œHeavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.â€

author: L'Express
title: La moitiÃ© des Ã©missions mondiales de CO2 sont dues Ã  36 entreprisesâ€¦ pour la plupart publiques
text:
20 de ces entreprises Ã©nergÃ©tiques sont dÃ©tenues par des Etats, dont la Chine et l'Arabie saoudite. La moitiÃ© des Ã©missions des CO2 provenant des combustibles fossiles et de la production ciment en 2023 Ã©mane de l'activitÃ© de seulement 36 entreprises, selon l'Ã©tude annuelle "Carbon Majors" du groupe d'experts indÃ©pendants britanniques Influence Map, publiÃ©e le 5 mars. A titre d'exemple, si l'entreprise pÃ©troliÃ¨re Saudi Aramco Ã©tait un pays, il figurerait 4e sur la liste des plus grands pollueurs du monde aprÃ¨s la Chine, les Etats-Unis et l'Inde. La sociÃ©tÃ© pÃ©troliÃ¨re et gaziÃ¨re amÃ©ricaine ExxonMobil produit quant Ã  elle autant de gaz Ã  effet de serre que l'Allemagne, illustre le rapport.
Selon les donnÃ©es d'Influence Map, les Ã©missions de ces entreprises ont par ailleurs augmentÃ© entre 2022 et 2023, l'annÃ©e la plus chaude jamais enregistrÃ©e Ã  l'Ã©poque. "La recherche met en Ã©vidence l'impact disproportionnÃ© que ces entreprises ont sur la crise climatique", souligne le chercheur et l'un des auteurs du rapport, Emmett Connaire. "MalgrÃ© les engagements climatiques mondiaux, un petit groupe des plus grands producteurs de combustibles fossiles au monde augmenteâ€¦
L'Express
